name: CNN
text: "We're not mourning for George Floyd. I don't think we or any of my staff are," the former CrossFit CEO said during a call hours before his controversial tweets Saturday referencing Floyd's death and Covid-19. "Can you tell me why I should mourn for him?" https://t.co/OenPBGHLuy

name: CNN
text:
Three sets of recordings. Three cries of "I can't breathe." Three black men who died shortly after struggles with law enforcement officers.

In the days since George Floyd's death, two similar encounters have come to wider public attention. https://t.co/2GjhKAi2QZ

name: CNN
text: Facebook has announced that it will lift the blanket ban on advertisements for face masks, which it introduced in the early weeks of the pandemic to help combat price gouging and medical supply shortages https://t.co/nhxjDXXP0H

name: CNN
text: George Floyd was laid to rest on June 9, after a widely attended service in Houston. On tonight’s #TheDailyDC podcast, we look back at the man at the heart of a movement for police reform.  https://t.co/AEFcHG28DQ https://t.co/ayy1KhzcK0

text: State officials who argue ICE officers undermine the justice system when they make arrests at courthouses just won a significant victory https://t.co/mY8iUOX689

name: CNN
text: Nearly 60 black former US ambassadors have condemned the deaths of George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, Ahmaud Arbery and others and called for reforms to address systemic racism and police brutality in the United States https://t.co/aUH15RKBJb

name: CNN
text: Myriad problems — long lines, inadequate staff — plagued Georgia's primary. What, exactly, happened? Who was to blame? And is there any chance we won't see a repeat of this debacle in the November election in the Peach State? | Analysis by @CillizzaCNN https://t.co/dgalw3rQZQ

name: CNN
text: Larry Kudlow is a former Wall Street-er turned cable TV host turned head of President Trump's economic team. So it's odd that he decided to offer his thoughts on whether he believes systemic racism still exists in America. | Analysis by @CillizzaCNN https://t.co/Rz6Zu6bevr

name: CNN
text: The Republican National Committee executive committee has unanimously approved a plan to significantly scale down the convention proceedings that will take place in Charlotte later this summer and to make no changes to the party's 2016 platform https://t.co/j3pQ3C3skN

name: CNN
text: Black Law Enforcement Alliance Director Mark Claxton says the Minneapolis police chief's withdrawal from negotiations with the city’s police union could potentially set a "very widespread nationwide precedent.” https://t.co/zovjzO3dRM https://t.co/0FY5DyKXXV

name: CNN
text: “The question that people need to ask is: What sort of incentives…does entertainment give to people who should be focused on good policing, not good entertainment?” says @dtaberski, whose podcast investigated the just-canceled show “Cops.” https://t.co/WJZUqkaYEa https://t.co/o5a6z0Em0W

name: CNN
text: RT @CNNnewsroom: “Pulling the movie…kind of moves the goal posts and it makes us lose focus on what we're actually asking for,” entertainment journalist @seguntheprogram says about HBO Max pulling “Gone With The Wind,” adding that its removal should ignite a conversation. https://t.co/tVo5YrNj93 https://t.co/wZPb7q1SOz

name: CNN
text:
"I find it completely ridiculous that people can't wrap their head around the idea that you do not get to be judge, jury and executioner in the streets of American citizens."

Civil rights activist Kimberly Jones on the death of George Floyd and others. https://t.co/J4e9fmUs1x https://t.co/v9qvVucIex
